It is not unprecedented for us to remove an entire thread. In fact, there's a whole little moderators-only subforum where we store these things. They are not deleted because we want to keep a record of our member's conduct for future reference: merely moved to this internal storage. That being said, neither is it a common thing for us to do, and we don't do it for whimsical reasons. It's a last-resort-kind-of-a-situation for threads which are so full of offensive material or built around such a problematic subject that there's no salvaging it. (Replies to a removed topic would be, of course, senseless.) 

Hiding a post from public view, or even deleting it (which we only do with spambots anyway) does NOT change the forum members' post count or like count. You keep those no matter what happens to the posts themselves. 

It would be nice if we could inform each person who posted in the thread when we do this, but there are several reasons that we don't. For one thing, as soon as we point out that something was removed, what happens is exactly what you're seeing here. Human nature being what it is, everybody wants to ask what was removed, which goes nowhere because it's something we can't discuss openly or it wouldn't have needed removal in the first place. If we didn't want to do it publicly we could send PMs, but that's simply a lot of PMs to post and dispatch. And last but not least, we do not advertise that something was removed because we do not want to encourage mass-shaming of the forum member who posted the troublesome content. You can see in this thread that there's already been some speculation about and attributing of motivations to the person in question, when in fact all any of us actually knows is that the content was posted. Does it really matter why? Moderation has always been a confidential thing, and we won't discuss the actions we do or do not take toward another person any more than you would want us telling others what we said and did to you. 

As for Red Iron Crown, real life demands and other interests have recently drawn several people away from the moderation team. But we also have a couple of new people. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") [The list of moderators](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/74320-your-moderators/) is kept current, if you want to know who is presently on the team.
